meanings.definition: to deliver a lecture or series of lectures
meanings.sent1: The professor prelected on the importance of history to the students.
meanings.sent2: She prelected passionately about the benefits of reading.
meanings.sent3: The cat prelected to the kittens about the art of catching mice.
meanings.sent4: The sun prelected to the flowers, teaching them how to bloom beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl prelected to the young owlets about the ways of the forest.

meanings.definition: having delivered a lecture or series of lectures
meanings.sent1: The prelected professor received a standing ovation from the audience.
meanings.sent2: She was a prelected speaker at the conference last week.
meanings.sent3: The prelected students were inspired to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent4: The prelected book left a lasting impact on the readers.
meanings.sent5: The prelected expert shared valuable insights with the listeners.

meanings.definition: the act of delivering a lecture or series of lectures
meanings.sent1: His prelected speech captivated the entire audience.
meanings.sent2: The prelected event was well-received by the attendees.
meanings.sent3: The prelected session left a lasting impression on the participants.
meanings.sent4: She prelected with confidence and clarity during the seminar.
meanings.sent5: The prelected talk sparked a lively discussion among the students.
